articles.headline: The Supreme Court Stopped Anti-Abortion Momentum. For Now.
articles.snippet: The movement has a long pipeline of new cases that, if taken up by the Supreme Court, could present a more direct challenge to Roe v. Wade.
articles.abstract: The movement has a long pipeline of new cases that, if taken up by the Supreme Court, could present a more direct challenge to Roe v. Wade.
articles.lead_paragraph: For anti-abortion activists, Monday’s Supreme Court ruling against a Louisiana law delivered a stinging and surprising setback. But perhaps not for long.
articles.byline: By Sabrina Tavernise and Elizabeth Dias

articles.headline: Trump Got Written Briefing in February on Possible Russian Bounties, Officials Say
articles.snippet: The investigation into Russia’s suspected operation is said to focus in part on the killings of three Marines in a truck bombing last year, officials said.
articles.abstract: The investigation into Russia’s suspected operation is said to focus in part on the killings of three Marines in a truck bombing last year, officials said.
articles.lead_paragraph: American officials provided a written briefing in late February to President Trump laying out their conclusion that a Russian military intelligence unit offered and paid bounties to Taliban-linked militants to kill U.S. and coalition troops in Afghanistan, two officials familiar with the matter said.
articles.byline: By Charlie Savage, Eric Schmitt, Nicholas Fandos and Adam Goldman

articles.headline: Reddit, Acting Against Hate Speech, Bans ‘The_Donald’ Subreddit
articles.snippet: The influential pro-Trump community broke the rules on harassment and targeting, said Reddit, which also banned other groups.
articles.abstract: The influential pro-Trump community broke the rules on harassment and targeting, said Reddit, which also banned other groups.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Reddit, one of the largest social networking and message board websites, on Monday banned its biggest community devoted to President Trump as part of an overhaul of its hate speech policies.

articles.headline: ‘Our Luck May Have Run Out’: California’s Case Count Explodes
articles.snippet: Los Angeles County, which has been averaging more than 2,000 new cases each day, surpassed 100,000 total cases on Monday.
articles.abstract: Los Angeles County, which has been averaging more than 2,000 new cases each day, surpassed 100,000 total cases on Monday.
articles.lead_paragraph: [Sign up to receive California Today, our newsletter from the Golden State, every weekday.]
articles.byline: By Shawn Hubler and Thomas Fuller

articles.headline: Business Embraces Hong Kong’s Security Law. The Money Helps.
articles.snippet: A flood of investment from China has tempered worries that Beijing’s tightening grip on the Asian financial capital would end its status as a lucrative place to do business.
articles.abstract: A flood of investment from China has tempered worries that Beijing’s tightening grip on the Asian financial capital would end its status as a lucrative place to do business.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — The business world has largely fallen in line behind China’s campaign to tighten its grip on Hong Kong, including its support for a new national security law that many residents fear will hurt the former British colony’s status as a laissez-faire, freethinking city.

articles.headline: $130 Billion Left at Paycheck Program Deadline, but Senate Acts to Extend It
articles.snippet: Forgivable loans went to nearly five million small businesses that could use the money to pay workers to stay home. Shifting rules blunted the effect.
articles.abstract: Forgivable loans went to nearly five million small businesses that could use the money to pay workers to stay home. Shifting rules blunted the effect.
articles.lead_paragraph: After a stumbling start, the government’s centerpiece relief program for small businesses was closing down on Tuesday — although it may turn out to be a temporary hiatus.

articles.headline: John Roberts Was Already Chief Justice. But Now It’s His Court.
articles.snippet: Chief Justice Roberts has replaced Justice Anthony M. Kennedy as the member of the Supreme Court at its ideological center, and his vote is now the crucial one in closely divided cases.
articles.abstract: Chief Justice Roberts has replaced Justice Anthony M. Kennedy as the member of the Supreme Court at its ideological center, and his vote is now the crucial one in closely divided cases.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In a series of stunning decisions over the past two weeks, Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. has voted to expand L.G.B.T.Q. rights, protect the young immigrants known as Dreamers and strike down a Louisiana abortion law. In all three decisions, he voted with the court’s four-member liberal wing.

articles.headline: With Much of the World’s Economy Slowed Down, Green Energy Powers On
articles.snippet: Wind giants are trying to shrug off the effects of the pandemic.
articles.abstract: Wind giants are trying to shrug off the effects of the pandemic.
articles.lead_paragraph: After a two-hour boat trip from Lowestoft, a seaside town on the east coast of England, giant wind mills more than 500 feet high loomed out of the mist like enormous sea creatures. High atop the towers, technicians in helmets and red-and-black protective suits were visible, fine-tuning the machines and hooking them up to the British power system.

articles.headline: Mnuchin and Powell Offer Mixed Views of Economic Recovery
articles.snippet: The Treasury secretary and the Fed chair discussed their approaches to rescuing the economy on Tuesday during a House Financial Services Committee hearing.
articles.abstract: The Treasury secretary and the Fed chair discussed their approaches to rescuing the economy on Tuesday during a House Financial Services Committee hearing.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Steven Mnuchin, the Treasury secretary, and Jerome H. Powell, the chair of the Federal Reserve, presented a mixed picture of the U.S. economy on Tuesday afternoon in testimony before Congress as lawmakers prepare for negotiations over another round of stimulus.
articles.byline: By Alan Rappeport and Jeanna Smialek

articles.headline: Supreme Court Gives Religious Schools More Access to State Aid
articles.snippet: Religious schools should have the same access to scholarships and funds as other private schools, the justices ruled, in a victory for conservatives.
articles.abstract: Religious schools should have the same access to scholarships and funds as other private schools, the justices ruled, in a victory for conservatives.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Supreme Court ruled on Tuesday that states must allow religious schools to participate in programs that provide scholarships to students attending private schools, a decision that opened the door to more public funding of religious education.
